section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance during any time of the day, including weekdays.
explanation: The contract states that i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, 24/7, but then introduces an exception for maintenance. The phrasing 'during any time of the day, including weekdays' contradicts the '24/7' uptime promise. This creates an ambiguity as it does not give any notice or timing of such maintenance which is a contradiction.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 20th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999.
explanation: The first sentence states the monthly fee is a fixed amount of $450. The second sentence introduces a variable element by stating the fees are due by the 20th of each month. This creates a contradiction because if fees are not paid by the 20th, the contract does not specify fees to be paid.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than five (5) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: The contract outlines an automatic renewal clause and a separate termination clause. The renewal clause states the contract renews for 'one (1) or more one (1) month periods'. This is ambiguous. Is it only one single one-month renewal, or multiple? Then, the termination clause allows either party to terminate with 30 days' notice 'at any time'. This contradicts the renewal clause as someone could terminate the agreement mid-month after it's automatically renewed, creating confusion on the obligations.
